text: Words for the Dying is the eleventh studio album by multi-instrumentalist John Cale. It was released in September 1989. It was produced by Brian Eno. == Track listing == # "Introduction" # "There Was a Saviour" # "Interlude I" # "On A Wedding Anniversary" # "Interlude II" # "Lie Still, Sleep Becalmed" # "Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night" # "Songs Without Words I" # "Songs Without Words II" # "The Soul Of Carmen Miranda" == Personnel == * John Cale − vocals, guitar, bass guitar, organ, viola * Nell Catchpole − violin * Brian Eno − keyboards * The Orchestra of Symphonic & Popular Music of Gostelradio * The Choir of Llandaff Cathedral Choir School Category:John Cale albums Category:1989 albums
title: Words for the Dying
